Jan de Lange is mathematician by education. (Leiden. Detroit, Utrecht). After teaching at high schools and universities he became educational reseacher at the Freudenthal Institute for Innovation in Mathematics Education (University Utrecht). Shortly thereafter het became leader and full professor/director of this institute. He initiated many new projects and activities like the Nieuwe Wiskrant (Math Magazine), National Mathematics Days, Math-A-lympiade, designed learning materials (Math-in-Context), designed curricula (mathematics A). At present he is senior designer of  a tablet based curriculum for mathematics for Pearson in the USA. 
He also was member or chair of many national and international commissions (Mathematical Sciences Education Board (Washington DC), Chair of International Expert Group PISA Mathematics (Paris, Melbourne), Visiting Professor University of Wisconsin (Madison), Honorary Chair Mathematics Education Research Institute (Being).

He founded the Project Curious MInds with Robbert Dijkgraaf & Johan van Benthem in 2005, and as a result the Book "Play Smart" was published in Dutch in 2013. It is about the amazing talents of young children, their curiosity, their reasoning skills, especially in the area of science and technology. It offers parents tools to facilitate a more complete cognitive development.This book is also the backbone of the recently started Young Parents Academy (jongeouderacademie.nl).
 
In 2011 he won the Lifetime Achievement Award van de International Society for Design and Development in Education (ISDDE).

He has presented numerous keynotes and lectures in 60 countries over a wide variety of subjects.

treasury_media.title: Curious Minds, Serious Play | Jan de Lange | TEDxAmsterdamED
treasury_media.description: Research has shown that it is necessary to facilitate the development of children's minds toward logical reasoning, creative problem solving and out-of-the box thinking. In this entertaining, thought-provoking talk, Jan de Lange shows us how stimulated play gives parents and educators the opportunity to play a vital role in this process - and help our young children to develop unexpected cognitive competencies.

profile_positions.description:
(jongeouderacademie.nl).The Young Parent Academy is an academy for parents of young children (3-7). Parents will experience new and different ways of interaction with their curious young kids, look in a different ways are their cognitive capabilities, and facilitate a more complete cognitive brain development, complementary to school. This takes place in the context of Science & Technology (STEM). Serious play indeed!

The first meeting took place for March 11, 2013, and was a success: 'sold out' (100 parents) and great reactions. The second session took place April 17: parents and their young kids played together for two hours, eliciting many hidden talents. The third and concluding session in June made clear that the Young Parent Academy can be considered a great success. Therefore the local government (Katwijk) has decided that in the year 2013/2014 three YPA's (JOA in Dutch) will take place, together with workshops and conference. In the school year 14/15 JOA' are introduced in Velsen (Rheden) and Rotterdam (Dominicusschool). Other cities with advanced plans include: Velsen, Noordwijk, Arnhem and Apeldoorn.

In April 2015 a very special YPA took place at DECOS in their beautiful office in Noodwijk. It will be a XL session with a guest speaker, new clips, and collaboration with the science centers Space expo, Naturalis and Boerhave. In February 2016 the next version took place.

YPA are in progress/have been held in Velp, Katwijk, Rotterdam, Utrecht, Noordwijk, Leiden, Kaag & Braassem. Inspiration presentation in various other cities. International presentations in Denmark, Germany and Poland.

Website: jongeouderacademie.nl
FaceBook:  JOA Katwijk
profile_positions.title: Founder/Director

profile_positions.description: Curious Minds is the free English translation of TalentenKracht, a project founded by Johan van Benthem (logician) of the University of Amsterdam and Stanford (USA), Robbert Dijkgraaf, (Theoretical Physics, University of Amsterdam and President of Royal Dutch Academy of Sciences) and Jan de Lange (Mathematician & math Educator, at that time Director Freudenthal Institute and full professor at Utrecht University).The project aimed and identifying scientific reasoning talents of young children (3-6), and informal learning. One of the main objectives is to have parents look differently at the talents these children have, starting with their natural curiousity. Jan was director for 5 years from 2005/2010. After this period he continued in this vein by founding the Young Parents Academy which had a very successful pilot start in his native town of Katwijk, the Netherlands. The book that plays an essential role in this academy is: Play Smart.(de Lange, Feijs, Munk, Broekhof, Cohen de Lara (2013), Zwijsen, Tilburg, The Netherlands)

profile_positions.title: Emeritus Professor

profile_positions.description:
Robbert Dijkgraaf, Johan van Benthem and myself founded the project TalentenKracht (Curious Minds) in 2005. Curiousity of young children as a  starting point for scientific reasoning, young children as the real researchers, making reasoning talents visible: key aspects of our approach to enrich the educational process of young children.
Initially six universities worked together to do research in this field. I was director of this project from 2005-2010.
I continue to make the resulting research valuable for practice.
profile_positions.title: Founder/Director

profile_positions.description: The Honorary Directorship can be seen as a reward for the work done by the Freudenthal Institute. At the the time I was Director of FI, and was awarded this Directorship in Beijng as part of a two week series of invited lectures in China.

profile_positions.description: Chairing the International Expert Committee for Mathematics for the Programme on Inrternational Student Assessment. Resposible for framework and designing/consulting on items.
profile_positions.title: PISA Chair International Expert Committee in Mathematics

profile_positions.description:
Joined Freudenthal Institute in 1976. Director in 1981. Became Full professor in 1989. Founded in 1980 the Nieuwe Wiskrant, the National Mathematics Days Conferences in the nineties, just like the Math A-lympiads.Expert in educational design. Presentations in more than 60 countries. 
Assessment Design Expert: National Examinations, PISA, Framework Classroom Assessment, Pearson Mathematics Common Core Math Curr., Problem Solving.
Director Freudenthal Institute/Director Freudenthal Insitute FI-US  Madison  WI, Boulder CO. USA.
profile_positions.title: Director/Professor

profile_positions.description: Coordinator Mathematics in Context Project (National Science Foundation), Principle Investigator CATCH project (Classroom Assessment as Tool for Teacher Change).
